p.k: A fascinating look at the work of George Cukor, who was a dialogue director in the early days of films with sound, and received an Academy Award in 1964 for My Fair Lady
Raphael's Head of a Young Apostle breaks records at an auction at Sotheby's. A desk believed to have been made for Madame de Pompadour also goes under
A first edition of The Tale of Peter Rabbit stands to fetch ?20,000 in London. Plus, silverware made for the marriage of Titanic victim John Jacob Astor goes on sale
The Irish all-female ensemble give a magical performance in America, featuring incredible visual effects and all their best-loved songs

p.n: Rembrandt From The National Gallery, London, and The Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam
p.k: New. Film exploring Rembrandt's key works in exhibitions in both London and Amsterdam
Who's Got The Lady? When a piece of art is stolen, the gallery owner gets his girlfriend to make copies of it to sell. But did the work ever really leave the building?
The Skeleton Key A woman discovers a nasty side to her husband's personality when he goes into hospital before a holiday

p.n: Landscape Artist Of The Year 2016 II (1)
p.k: Frank Skinner and Joan Bakewell search for a new star landscape artist as contestants capture National Trust properties across the country, starting
A look at the life of Academy Award-winning Maggie Smith. From Harry Potter to Downton Abbey, her huge portfolio makes her one of the UK's most recognisable actresses
A look at the Academy Award-winning actor, best known for his starring role in Gandhi. He has also appeared in films such as Shutter Island and Iron Man 3
A Passing Opportunity Frank is struggling financially and will do anything for money. When he meets a rich and successful schoolmate, he realises
A Memory Man Down on his luck, 'Memory Man' Colin agrees to help a shady character remember the number of a station locker. But then Colin becomes
Noddy Holder narrates as the series takes a fascinating trip back to 1960s America to take a look at the evolution of funk music

p.n: Landscape Artist Of The Year 2016 II (2)
p.k: The competition continues as hosts Frank Skinner and Joan Bakewell welcome eight new artists and 50 wildcard entries to the stunning Wray Castle in Cumbria
White Landscape The photographers travel to the spectacular Trentino region of northern Italy, where they must capture the challenging whiteness of the mountains
Acclaimed for her performance as Elizabeth II in The Queen, this is a glimpse into the world of the Academy Award-winning actress
A look at the British Academy Award-winning actress who has starred in a host of films including Julia, Mission: Impossible and Murder on the Orient Express
This eye-opening documentary by Clara and Julia Kuperberg tells the story of the Warner brothers, four sons of Polish immigrants who went on to take over Hollywood

n.u: The Great Film Composers: Music Of The Movies

p.k: The Birth of the Film Score Venture back to the birth of soundtracks. Music scores were played live until the first fully-composed film
Pink Floyd drummer Nick Mason gives Brian Johnson a tour of his car collection in the Cotswolds and reveals the secrets behind his band's elaborate live shows

p.n: Pink Floyd: Classic Albums The Dark Side Of The Moon
p.k: Prog rock icons Pink Floyd reflect on the creation of their hugely influential concept album, with rarely seen archive studio footage
